title: Quiz 2 - HCF & LCM
instruction: Given below are two quantities. Based on the given information, you have to determine the relation between the two quantities. You should use the given data to choose among the possible answers.

quiz.text: The greatest number of four digits that is divisible by 15, 25, 40, and 75 is:
options: 9000
9400
9600
9800
None of the above

quiz.text: A, B and C start at the same time in the same direction to run around a circular stadium. A completes a round in 252 seconds, B in 308 seconds and c in 198 seconds, all starting at the same point. After what time will they again at the starting point?
options: 26 min and 18 sec
42 min and 36 sec
45 min
46 min and 12sec
None of the above

quiz.text: The least number which when divided by 5, 6 , 7 and 8 leaves a remainder 3, but when divided by 9 leaves no remainder, is:
options: 1677
1683
2523
3363
None of the above

quiz.text: The least number which should be added to 2497 so that the sum is exactly divisible by 7, 5, 6, 4 and 3 is:
options: 23
27
21
17
29

quiz.text: The product of two numbers is 2028 and their H.C.F. is 13. The number of such pairs is:
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: The least multiple of 7, which leaves a remainder of 4, when divided by 6, 9, 15 and 18 is:
options: 174
294
184
364
None of the above

quiz.text: The H.C.F. of two numbers is 11 and their L.C.M. is 7700. If one of the numbers is 275, then the other is:
options: 379
345
308
329
339

quiz.text: The product of LCM and HCF of two natural numbers is 425. The difference of two numbers is 8. Find the numbers?
options: 13,21
17, 25
15, 23
25, 33
None of these

quiz.text: Find the greatest number which when divides 564 and 467 leaves the remainder as 4 and 7 respectively.
options: 35
30
25
20
15

quiz.text: On dividing a number by 4, the remainder is 2. The quotient so obtained when divided by 5, leaves the remainder 3. Now the quotient so obtained when divided by 6, leaves the remainder 5. The last quotient is 7. The number was?
options: 954
999
978
944
928

quiz.text: Three numbers which are co-prime to each other are such that the product of the first two is 551 and that of the last two is 1073. The sum of the three numbers is:
options: 75
81
85
89
None of these

quiz.text: The length, breadth and height of a room are 363m, 528m and 693m respectively. Determine the longest tape that can measure the three dimensions of the room exactly.
options: 25 meters
27 meters
35 meters
33 meters
None of the above

quiz.text: Series - a, 18, 27, b, 13.5, c, 6.75 If the LCM and HCF of a and b is 54 and 9 respectively. And the ratio of a to b is 6:1, where a > b. Then find a?
options: 18
45
54
66
73

quiz.text: Series - a, 18, 27, b, 13.5, c, 6.75 If the LCM and HCF of a and b is 54 and 9 respectively. And the ratio of a to b is 6: 1, respectively, where a > b. Then find b?
options: 9
16
23
32
44

quiz.text: Series - a, 18, 27, b, 13.5, c, 6.75 If the LCM and HCF of a and b is 54 and 9 respectively. And the ratio of a to b is 6: 1, respectively, where a > b. Then find c?
options: 3.5
5.5
5
7.5
4.5

quiz.text: If the LCM and HCF of a and b from the above series is 238 and 1 respectively. And the difference between a and b is 27, where b>a>0. Then find a and b.
options: 7, 29
7, 34
5, 34
5, 29
7, 17

quiz.text: If there is another series with the first term as 3, which follows the same logic as the logic of the series given above. Then find the 4th term of this series. Note – Use the value of a and b as calculated previously.
options: 150
145
165
154
None of the above

quiz.text: Find the greatest number that will divide 43, 91, and 183 so as to leave the same remainder in each case.
options: 4
7
5
9
3

quiz.text: The L.C.M. of two numbers is 48. The numbers are in the ratio 2 : 3. Then sum of the number is:
options: 26
40
18
64
46

quiz.text: The greatest number which on dividing 1657 and 2037 leaves remainders 6 and 5 respectively, is:
options: 308
121
127
137
139

quiz.text: Quantity I: Let N be the greatest number that will divide 1305, 4665, and 6905, leaving the same remainder in each case. Then sum of the digits in N. Quantity II: The product of two numbers is 4107. If the H.C.F. of these numbers is 37, then the greater number is:
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: Three number are in the ratio of 3 : 4 : 5 and their L.C.M. is 2400. Their H.C.F. is? Quantity II:
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: Find the least number which when divided by 12, 27 and 35 leaves 6 as a remainder? Quantity II: Find the 4-digit smallest number which when divided by 12, 15, 25, 30 leaves no remainder?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: Find the least number which when divided by 2, 3, 4 and 5 leaves a remainder 3. But when divided by 9 leaves no remainder? Quantity II: Four Iron metal rods of lengths 78 cm, 104 cm, 117 cm and 169 cm are to be cut into parts of equal length. Each part must be as long as possible. What is the maximum number of pieces that can be cut?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: The product of LCM and HCF of two natural numbers is 48. The difference of two numbers is 8. Find the greater numbers? Quantity II: The HCF and LCM of two numbers are 8 and 48 respectively. If one of the numbers is 24, then the other number is?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or no relation
